Instruction: Mix 1 cup sugar, cocoa powder, hot water, and 1 teaspoon vanilla extract until the sugar dissolves to create the batter. Pour the batter into the pie shells.

Combine the flour and baking powder in a separate bowl; keep aside. Cream together the butter and 1 cup of sugar. Beat in the vanilla, followed by the eggs one at a time. Mix in half of the milk, then half of the flour until combined. Add the remaining milk and flour gradually. Carefully spoon this batter over the chocolate batter ensuring full coverage on top without chocolate showing.
